page.title: 01The Town Centre of Skegness
page.content: Skegness is a middle-sized seaside resort, purposely designed in the 19th century. The resort caters for many visitors during the summer months, while the townspeople enjoy a varied range of activities during the "closed season". Although it seems to be the trend for more of the seafront hotels to open during the Christmas period. The majority of the area is dedicated to the tourist industry in the form of railway, amusements, shopping and residences for holiday makers, including caravan sites. Many of the residents are elderly, retired people who enjoy the climate and the comparative quiet of area out of season. The symbol of Skegness is{"The Jolly {Fisherman"}.
